HelpXML.Title: FSMtra
HelpXML.Purpose: FSMtra computes MLE of transformation parameters.

Item.Name: Y
Item.LongDesc: n x v data matrix; n observations and v variables. Rows of Y represent observations, and columns represent variables. Missing values (NaN's) and infinite values (Inf's) are allowed, since observations (rows) with missing or infinite values are automatically excluded from the computations.

Item.Name: family
Item.ShortDesc: string which identifies the family of transformations which must be used.
Item.LongDesc: Possible values are 'BoxCox' (default) or 'YJ'. The Box-Cox family of power transformations equals $(y^{\lambda}-1)/\lambda$ for $\lambda$ not equal to zero, and $\log(y)$ if $\lambda = 0$. The Yeo-Johnson (YJ) transformation is the Box-Cox transformation of $y+1$ for nonnegative values, and of $|y|+1$ with parameter 2-lambda for y negative. The basic power transformation returns $y^{\lambda}$ if $\lambda$ is not zero, and $\log(\lambda)$ otherwise. Remark. BoxCox and the basic power family can be used just if input y is positive. Yeo-Johnson family of transformations does not have this limitation.

Item.Name: init
Item.ShortDesc: Point where to start monitoring required diagnostics.
Item.LongDesc: Note that if bsb is suppliedinit>=length(bsb). If init is not specified it will be set equal to floor(n*0.6).

Item.Name: bsb
Item.ShortDesc: It contains the units forming initial subset.
Item.LongDesc: The default value of bsb is '' that is the initial subset is found through the intersection of robust bivariate ellipses This option is useful if a forced start is required.

Item.Name: rf
Item.LongDesc: Default is 0.9. If bsb is not empty this argument is ignored.

Item.Name: ColToTra
Item.ShortDesc: It specifies the variables which must be transformed.
Item.LongDesc: It is a k x 1 integer vector.

Item.Name: la0
Item.ShortDesc: It contains set of transformation parameters for the k ColtoTra.
Item.LongDesc: It is a k x 1 vector. The ordering of Mahalanobis distances at each step of the forward search uses variables transformed with la0. la0 empty is equivalent to its default value la0=ones(length(ColToTra),1).

Item.Name: onelambda
Item.ShortDesc: If onelambda=1, a common value lambda is estimated for all variables specified in ColToTra.

Item.Name: optmin
Item.ShortDesc: It contains the options dealing with the maximization algorithm.
Item.LongDesc: Use optimset to set these options. Notice that the maximization algorithm which is used is fminunc is the optimization toolbox is present else is fminsearch.

Item.Name: speed
Item.ShortDesc: If speed=1 the initial value at step m of the maximization procedure is the final value at step m-1 else it is la0.
Item.LongDesc: Default value 1. The maximization procedure is fminunc or fminsearch.

Item.Name: colnames
Item.ShortDesc: It contains the names of the variables of the dataset.
Item.LongDesc: Cell array of strings of length v. If colnames is empty then the sequence 1:v is created to label the variables.

Item.Name: prolik
Item.ShortDesc: It specifies whether it is necessary to monitor the profile log likelihood of the transformation parameters at selected steps of the search.

ItemCell.Description: vector containing the steps of the fwd search for which profile logliks have to be plotted. The default value of steps is n;
scalar between 0 and 1 determining confidence level for each element of lambda based on the asymptotic chi1^2 of twice the loglikelihood ratio. The default confidence level is 0.95;
vector with two elements determining minimum and maximum values of lambda in the plots of profile loglikelihoods. The default value of xlim is [-2 2];
line width of the vertical lines defining confidence levels of the transformation parameters.

Item.Name: plotsmle
Item.ShortDesc: It specifies whether it is necessary to plot the maximum likelihood estimates of the transformation parameters.

ItemCell.Description: minimum and maximum on the x axis;
minimum and maximum on the y axis;
Line width of the trajectories of mle of transformation parameters;
Line width of the horizontal lines;
tag of the plot (default is pl_mle);
font size of the text labels which identify the trajectories.

Item.Name: plotslrt
Item.ShortDesc: It specifies whether it is necessary to plot the likelihood ratio test.

ItemCell.Description: minimum and maximum on the x axis;
minimum and maximum on the y axis;
Line width of the trajectory of lrt of transformation parameters;
vector which defines the confidence levels of the horizontal line for the likelihood ratio test (default is conflev=[0.95 0.99]);
Line width of the horizontal lines;
tag of the plot (default is pl_lrt).

Item.Name: msg
Item.ShortDesc: It controls whether to display or not messages about great interchange on the screen.
Item.LongDesc: If msg==1 (default) messages are displayed on the screen else no message is displayed on the screen.

ItemCell.Description: (n-init) x 11 Matrix which contains the unit(s) included in the subset at each step of the fwd search. REMARK: in every step the new subset is compared with the old subset. Un contains the unit(s) present in the new subset but not in the old one Un(1,2) for example contains the unit included in step init+1 Un(end,2) contains the units included in the final step of the search

References.Item: Atkinson Riani and Cerioli (2004), Exploring multivariate data with the forward search Springer Verlag, New York.
